attributes.comment:
I am submitting my comments regarding the proposed rule change for the U.S.
Citizenship and Immigration Services, which has the docket number USCIS-2006-
0044. This would raise filing fees for services associated with international
adoption. My family is in the process of adopting from China. We have already
paid $685 to the USCIS ($545 for I-600A and $140 for fingerprints). With the wait
for our adoption increasing, we will have to renew our fingerprints and our 171-H --
this means another $685 (or more if the fees are increased) for our family.
Currently we have spent close to $10,000 for adoption expenses and fees and
need another $15,000 to complete the adoption. I would please ask that you
would NOT INCREASE these fees. International adoption is extremely expensive
and adding to that expense will make the process even more difficult for families,
especially when having to pay the fee twice. Many families have to borrow money
to adopt internationally -- any increased fees only increases the financial burden
families are already facing. Please reconsider this increase. By not increasing
these fees your agency will be supporting families and encouraging adoption,
which provides homes and families for orphaned children around the world.
Adoption is a wonderful miracle that grows families and spreads love, please
support adoption and DO NOT INCREASE THESE FEES.
Thank you so much for your time and consideration in this extremely important
matter.
Marcy Taylor
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Marcy Taylor
